com.github.brunothg.game.engine.image.sprite

Class BufferedSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.brunothg.game.engine.image.sprite.BufferedSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sprite

    public class BufferedSprite
extends Object
implements Sprite
    A Sprite that initially divides the provided image into sub-images. First creation is slower and consumes more memory than the unbuffered Sprite, but calls to get/drawTile are much faster.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile(Graphics2D g,
            int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height)
        Draws a tile of this sprite. The tile is drawn with Bounds(0, 0, width, height).
        Specified by:
        drawTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object to draw on
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        width - The width of the Graphics object to draw on
        height - The height of the Graphics object to draw on

      • getTile

        public BufferedImage getTile(int x,
                    int y)
        Get a tile of this sprite. Creates a copy of the underlying tile. Otherwise the original tile would be transformed. User drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) for faster action.
        Specified by:
        getTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the tile

      • getSubSprite

        public Sprite getSubSprite(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get sub-sprite with given dimension. The returned DerivedSprite is linked with this sprite.
        Specified by:
        getSubSprite in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of first tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of first tile
        width - Width of the sub-sprite
        height - Height of the sub-sprite
        Returns:
        The sub-sprite in form of a DerivedSprite
